_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Braskem America, Marcus Hook Polymers

Risk Management Program (RMP) Plan

Executive Summary





Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Braskem's management has made the commitment to safety a top priority. Overall responsibility for safety resides with the Facility Manager.  Management is directly involved in the several Teams that oversee the Safety Programs.   These Teams are composed of a broad cross section of the employees.

The HES group oversees the implementation of the facility's risk management program.  The facility has an Emergency Response Team, consisting of fully trained volunteer members on duty for all shifts.



Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled

The Braskem Marcus Hook Polymers facility manufactures Polypropylene, one of the most useful of plastics.  It is inert, non-toxic, non-hazardous and burns poorly.

Propylene is the major hazardous material on site and it is this material which places Braskem in the RMP Program.  Similar to propane in characteristics, it is flammable and potentially explosive if mixed with air in sufficient concentration.  It is handled under pressure in both its gaseous and liquid forms. 



General Accident Release Prevention and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

Braskem's Marcus Hook Polymers facility has active Risk Management and Process Safety Management programs.  Various elements of the program are distributed to site personnel,  who manage their elements under the coordination of the Process Safety Manager and Facility Manager.

Facility employees participate in appropriate areas of the PSM/ RM programs such as participating as members of process hazard analysis (PHA) teams, management of change (MOC) reviews, incident investigations, etc.  The company also works closely with outside agencies, including involving the outside agencies in company training programs.  Some features of the program include:

- Fully trained operations and maintenance departments.

- OSHA PS

M/ EPA Risk Management Program, including:

 - Employee Participation

 - Process Safety Information

 - Process Hazards Analysis

 - Operating Procedures

 - Personnel training

 - Emergency Response and Planning

 - Incident Investigations

 - Contractor Compliance Verification

 - Mechanical Integrity

 - Hot Work Permits

 - Management Of Change Procedures

 - Pre-Startup Safety Review

 - Compliance Audits

- Insurance Provider Inspections and Standards.



Five Year Accident History

Braskem's  Marcus Hook Polymers facility has had no RMP reportable incidents since the last plan submittal in 2009. 



Emergency Response Programs In Place

The facility utilizes a number of monitoring, detection, and suppression systems to prevent, detect, and mitigate fires and releases of hazardous materials.  These include:

- Computerized process control / alarm/ interlock shutdown system.

- Emergency shutdown/kill systems.

- Gas detectors.

- Flame detectors.

- Automatic and manually activated water spray/sprinkler systems

- Fire extinguishers

- Centralized alarm system.

- Fully Trained Emergency Response Team.

- Communications Systems: Radios, Emergency Phones, PA system, Emergency Call Procedures.

- Emergency Evacuation Procedures and Drills.

- Fire Water System: Hydrants, Monitors, Hose Stations, and Backup Firewater system.

- Diking and Burn Pits for Pyrophoric Liquids.



The company also actively works with the local emergency planning committee, fire department, police department and other appropriate agencies.  These activities include:

- Emergency Reporting through the County LEPC (911).

- Agency reporting:

- PA-DEP, National Response Center, State Emergency Operations Center.

- Environmental Advisory Committee Reporting

- "SARA" Hazardous Material Reporting, County and Local, State

- Mutual Aid Agreements.

- Drills with local Emergency Response Teams and area Company Response Teams.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Braskem believes in a philo

sophy of continuous improvement.  A number of programs are in place to monitor the status of ongoing efforts and continually seek opportunities to improve.  For example, the facility maintains a Safety Suggestion program to continually improve Safety.  As another example, Braskem Marcus Hook Polymers is preparing to enter OSHAs' Voluntary Protection Program (VPP), which requires a strong, voluntary commitment to the highest Safety standards.
